title: Sophie Calle Intro
transcript:
“I met people who were born blind. Who had never seen. I asked them what their image of beauty was.” –Sophie Calle
In her work The Blind, artist Sophie Calle asked people who were born blind to describe their “image of beauty.” The work is arranged into 23 chapters. Each chapter brings together a black and white portrait of the person, a short statement by them, and one or more color photographs representing the people, places, or things they have named as beautiful. What follows are verbal descriptions of five chapters from the work. Each description begins with a reading of the subject’s description of beauty.
